sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"计算"之意。
means: calculate ： 通常指要求细致精确和复杂的计算，以解决疑难问题，多用于自然科学、生产部门或要求专门计算的场合。
count ： 指逐一计算而得出总数。
compute ： 一般指已有数据的，较简单但数字长的数学运算。
reckon ： 通常指较简单的数学计算，也可指心算。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"认为"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: consider, think, believe, count, deem, reckon, regard
means: consider ： 指经过考虑和观察后得出的结论。
think ： 普通用词，指按照自己的意见提出看法。
believe ： 通常指根据一定的证据，经思考后而认为属实。
count ： 指作出判断后而得出的看法等。
deem ： 正式用词，常用于法律、文学，强调作判断而不是思考。
reckon ： 指对人或事作全面"权衡"，把各方面意见考虑进去后得出结论。
regard ： 侧重凭外表或表面现象作判断。多强调观点。

sentence.Network_en: I reckon I'm due one of my travels.
sentence.Network_cn: 我想我就要开始我的一次旅行了.

sentence.Network_en: Don't reckon upon your relatives to help you out of trouble.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要指望你的亲戚会帮助你摆脱困境.

sentence.Network_en: Don't reckon upon the weather being fine for your garden party.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要指望你举行游园会时会是好天气.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 个人简历英文翻译词汇大全_百度文库 ... reinforce 加强 reckon 计算（成本等） renew 重建，换新.
英语新标准初中二年级上册单词表_百度知道 ... prize  n． 奖品，奖金 reckon   v． 考虑；认为 sound   v. 听起来.
揣测_百度百科 ... [conjecture] 纯熟虚构 [reckon] 猜想；估计 [guess] 推测.
数学英语词汇表[翻译必看] ... thermodynamics n. [物] 热力学 reckon vt. 计算, 总计, 估计, 猜想 strength 强度.

list.abs: 久石让歌曲 ... +太阳照常升起- The Sun Also Rises +最后的一枪- Final Reckoning +背叛之夜- Night Of The Betrayal.
reckon as看做reckon on依靠；指望；希冀calculate reckon推算
reckon as看做reckon on依靠；指望；希冀calculate reckon推算
recitation 背诵；详述；列举reckon up 合计reckon 数
dead pulley 空转轮dead reckoning 位置坐标推算法dead rock 脉石
推算定位（Dead reckoning）是典型的独立定位技术。卫星定位技术是把卫星定位接收器安装在车辆上来获得车辆位置。

jx.jx_en_mean: To come to terms or settle accounts with.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 向…结算：与……解决或……结清帐目

phrase.cizu_name: a —to be reckoned with (或 to reckon with)

jx.jx_en_mean: a thing or person of considerable importance or ability that is not to be ignored or underestimated

lj.lj_ly: the trade unions were a political force to be reckoned with.
lj.lj_ls: 工会是一股不可小视的政治力量。

jx.jx_en_mean: take (or fail to take) into account
jx.jx_cn_mean: （未）估计到，（未）考虑到；（未）预料到

lj.lj_ly: they hadn't reckoned with a visit from Eunice.
lj.lj_ls: 他们没有预料到尤妮斯的来访。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English (ge)recenian 'recount, relate', of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch rekenen and German rechnen 'to count (up'). Early senses included 'give an account of items received' and 'mention things in order', which gave rise to the notion of ‘calculation ’and hence of ‘coming to a conclusion’

entry.def: If you reckon that something is true, you think that it is true.

example.ex: Toni reckoned that it must be about three o'clock...
example.tran: 托妮估计当时肯定是3点钟左右。

example.ex: He reckoned he was still fond of her.
example.tran: 他认为自己还喜欢着她。

entry.def: If you say that something is reckoned to be true, you mean that people think that it is true.

example.ex: The sale has been held up because the price is reckoned to be too high.
example.tran: 销售陷入停滞，因为大家认为价格太高了。

entry.def: If you say that someone reckons to do something, you mean that they expect to do it.

example.ex: The merged banks reckon to raise 4 billion dollars of new equity next year...
example.tran: 几家银行合并后明年有望增发40亿美元的新股。

example.ex: Police officers on the case are reckoning to charge someone very shortly.
example.tran: 调查这个案子的警官正在考虑尽快起诉嫌疑人。

entry.def: If something is reckoned to be a particular figure, it is calculated to be roughly that amount.

example.ex: The star's surface temperature is reckoned to be minus 75 degrees Celsius...
example.tran: 这颗恒星的表面温度估计在零下75摄氏度左右。

example.ex: There was a proportion of research, which I reckoned at not more than 30 percent, that was basic research.
example.tran: 我估计基础研究的比例最多只占30％。

sentences.sentence: "I imagine she earned a lot of money with her new novel"

"he didn't think to find her in the kitchen"
"I guess she is angry at me for standing her up"
"She views this quite differently from me"
"I don't see the situation quite as negatively as you do"

means.word_mean: 4. make a mathematical calculation or computation

sentences.sentence: "you can count on me to help you any time"
"Depend on your family in times of crisis"
"You have to reckon with our opponents"

auth_sentence.res_content: Someone can reckon I'd better change my attitude.

Sentence.sentence: Perhaps it will become the mark of an author to reckon with that he or she is still published in hard copy.
Demographers (人口统计学者) reckon that three-quarters of humanity could be city-dwelling by 2050, with most of the increase coming in the fast-growing towns of Asia and Africa.

sentences.en: Reckon the cost before you decide.
sentences.cn: 先算一下费用, 然后再作决定。

sentences.en: I reckon that he will come soon.
I reckon that he is old enough.
sentences.cn: 我认为他的年龄已经够大了。

sentences.en: She has always been reckoned as clever.
sentences.cn: 大家一直认为她是个聪明人。

sentences.en: Our pay is reckoned from the 1st of the month.
sentences.cn: 我们的薪水从每月的第一天算起。

jushi.english: We reckon to arrive in Hong Kong at night.
jushi.chinese: 我们估计晚上抵达香港。
